1.body: Ownership Buy/sell Profit & risk Mudarabah Murabahah
1.title: Business

10.body: Buy a futures contract for k barrels at $p per barrel, delivery in m months. If the market price is more than $p, one will sell the contract before delivery. “Sale of a promise” rather than “sale of an asset” In practice, both parties close their position early.
10.title: Futures

11.body: The thing that you buy must actually exist 1 Can I buy and sell ownership of company? How often can I buy and sell? Valid sale clear ownership Full payment or clear terms Riba is only twice the amount and above based on 3:130?
11.title: Shariah laws

12.body: Written contract [1] Collateral [1] Witnesses [1] Defaulting — mercy [2] Demanding more money is riba [3] Money lending is considered charity Excess amount Delayed settlement [3:130]
12.title: Loan / money lending

13.body: = guaranteed profit = necessarily creates disadvantage, unfair burden, injustice, even if not immediately. الغنم بالغرم There is no profit without risk
13.title: Guaranteed returns

14.body: Allah has permitted trade and forbidden riba (interest) [1] Agreeing to a riba in contract is problematic because you are implicated. borrower, lender, writer, witnesses [2] Surah Al-Baqarah 2:275 Gold for gold, silver for silver, wheat for wheat, barley for barley, dates for dates, salt for salt — equal for equal, same for same, hand to hand. If they differ, then sell as you wish, provided it is hand to hand. (Sahih Muslim 1587, also in Bukhari) The Messenger of Allah cursed the one who consumes riba, the one who pays it, the one who records it, and the two witnesses to it, and he said: They are all the same. Sahih Muslim, Hadith 1598
14.title: Interest

15.body: Do not sell what you do not possess. [1] Sahih Muslim 1513
15.title: Buying and selling

16.body: مرابحة Mark-up مداربة Profit sharing A financial instrument is anything (asset that holds monetary value or contract) that can be traded. Leveraged products amplify your exposure to the movement of an asset i.e. make or lose more than you invest. Examples: CDF Options Futures Leveraged ETFs Margin trading
16.title: Glossary

2.body: Index Stocks Fund Mutual fund / unit trust ETF Hedge fund Fixed income Bonds Treasury bills Treasury notes Time Deposit Sukuk Takaful Insurance Currency Commodities REITs Derivatives Futures Options
2.title: Finance

3.body: Shariah laws Money lending Guaranteed returns Riba Buy / sell Glossary
3.title: Shariah laws

4.body: An index consists of a group of assets. Purpose: to track the performance of a specific section of the market
4.title: Index

5.body: Tradable. Price based on market price. Trading a portion of a company that you own Selling a share in a business to another. Buyer receives rights to profits.
5.title: Stocks

6.body: A pool of money from many investors. Purpose: buys assets based on a strategy Holdings are typically published.
6.title: Fund

7.body: aka mutual fund, fund Not traded. Unit price based on NAV. Actively managed. Investor receives units that represent their share in the fund.
7.breadcrumbs: Fund » Mutual fund / unit trust » Mutual fund / unit trust
7.title: Mutual fund / unit trust

8.body: Tradable. Price based on market price. Passively managed (because the group of assets don’t really change mich); the fund holds all or most of the same stocks as the index that is being tracked.
8.title: ETF

9.body: aka loans Characteristics: Regular payments Guaranteed interest
9.title: Fixed income
